title: Baked Beef Meatballs
description: A tasty twist on classic pasta. Tender beef meatballs are baked directly in a rich, homemade tomato sauce for maximum flavour and minimal cleanup, served over al dente linguine with a melting cheddar finish.
steps: Combine the beef mince, panko breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix thoroughly before rolling into 6 meatballs.
Peel and finely grate the red onion.
Place the meatballs over the grated onion in an oven-proof dish with a drizzle of olive oil and bake for 5-6 minutes to soften the onion.
Dissolve the stock cube, tomato paste, and a pinch of sugar in 150ml boiled water, then mix in oregano, vinegar, and chopped tomatoes.
Pour the tomato sauce into the baking dish and cook for 25-30 minutes until the sauce thickens to a ragÃ¹ consistency.
Boil the linguine in salted water for 8-10 minutes until al dente, then drain.
Remove the dish from the oven, stir in the spinach to wilt, and serve over the linguine topped with grated cheddar and black pepper.
tips: Grating the onion instead of chopping it allows it to melt into the sauce, creating a smoother texture and richer flavour base.
If the sauce thickens too much in the oven, splash a little pasta water in before serving to loosen it up.
Ensure the meatballs are evenly sized so they cook through at the same rate.
